    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    ActiveActor
    Represents an active actor in the game, which extends the ImageView class.
    ActiveActorDestructible
    Represents a destructible active actor in the game, extending the ActiveActor class and implementing the Destructible interface.
    ActorManager
    Manages all active actors (friendly units, enemy units, projectiles) in the game, handling updates and removal of destroyed actors.
    Boss
    Represents a Boss character in the game.
    Boss2
    Represents the second Boss character in the game.
    Boss2Projectile
    Represents a projectile fired by the Boss2 in the game.
    BossProjectile
    Represents a projectile fired by the Boss in the game.
    ButtonImage
    A class representing an image used as a button in the application.
    CollisionManager
    Manages collision detection and response between different game actors (friendly units, enemy units, projectiles).
    Controller
    The Controller class manages the flow of the game, including level transitions and stage setup.
    Destructible
    Represents an entity that can take damage and be destroyed.
    EndingMenu
    The EndingMenu class represents the end-game menu of the application.
    EnemyPlane
    Represents an enemy plane character in the game.
    EnemyProjectile
    Represents a projectile fired by an enemy in the game.
    FighterPlane
    Represents a fighter plane in the game.
    GameOverImage
    A class representing an image displayed when the game is over.
    HeartDisplay
    A class for displaying hearts as indicators of life or health.
    LevelFour
    The LevelFour class represents the fourth level of the game.
    LevelObserver
    The LevelObserver interface defines the methods required to be implemented by observers that track changes in game levels.
    LevelOne
    Represents the first level in the game, LevelOne.
    LevelParent
    Abstract base class for all game levels.
    LevelSceneInitialization
    Handles the initialization of the game scene, including setting up the background image and game timeline.
    LevelSceneInitializationTest
    Test class for `LevelSceneInitialization`.
    LevelThree
    Represents the third level of the game, featuring a boss fight and enemy wave spawns.
    LevelTwo
    Represents the second level of the game, featuring a boss fight.
    LevelView
    Represents the view for a level in the game, managing the display of elements like health, win/lose screens.
    Main
    The main entry point for the JavaFX application.
    Menu
    This class represents the main menu of the application, handling UI setup, button actions, and scene management for the game's main menu.
    MenuImage
    A class representing a menu background image in a JavaFX application.
    Projectile
    Represents a base class for projectiles in the game.
    SettingMenu
    The SettingMenu class is responsible for managing the settings menu of the application.
    SettingMenuTest
    Unit tests for the SettingMenu class.
    ShieldImage
    A class representing a shield image in a JavaFX application.
    ShieldImageTest
    Test class for `ShieldImage`.
    SoundEffects
    Manages sound effects and background music for the game.
    UserInputSystem
    Manages user input handling, responding to key presses for player movement and actions.
    UserPlane
    Represents the user's plane in the game.
    UserPlaneTest
    Unit tests for the UserPlane class.
    UserProjectile
    Represents a user-controlled projectile in the game.
    UserProjectileManager
    Manages the user's projectiles within the game.
    UserProjectileManagerTest
    Unit tests for the UserProjectileManager class.
    Window
    A singleton class for managing the main application window.
    WinImage
    A class representing a "Win" image in a JavaFX application.
